1.text: Soak the epoxy and hardener bottles in warm water for 15–20 minutes.

2.text: Dry the bottles off completely to avoid mixing water with the resin.

3.text: Combine the epoxy and hardener in a disposable container.

4.text: Turn a heat gun to the lowest setting.

5.text: Move the heat gun 6 inches (15 cm) above the surface you’re treating.

6.text: Pour the epoxy onto the warm surface.

7.text: Spread the epoxy on the surface with a foam brush.

8.text: Blow the poured epoxy with your heat gun to remove any bubbles.

9.text: Opt for acetone or denatured alcohol.

10.text: Test the solvent you’re using on the surface to see if it causes damage.

11.text: Stir the thinner into the epoxy so it’s 10–20% of the volume.

12.text: Allow at least 1 day for the epoxy to cure.
